cases.title: Conjugation of full-length fibrils
cases.description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6rbli","text":"Conjugation of full-length fibrils with pHrodo/Alexa dyes/BODIPY-FL NHS ester","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":68,"length":9,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2of78","text":"7 steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ln8u","text":"1. Dissolve 100 ug of dye in 50 ul of sterile DMSO (2 mg/mL) 
2. Dilute fibrils to 1mg/mL concentration in PBS containing 0.1M bicarbonate (total volume: 0.95 mL)
3. Add 50 ug of dissolved dye to each reaction tube
4. Incubate overnight in eppendorf tube (foil-wrapped) with continuous shaking
5. In the morning, spin down the dye-fibril solution at 10,000 g for 10 min at 10C
6. Transfer the supernatant and dissolve the pellet with 1 mL of PBS (repeat 5 times)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bonru","text":"Measure size of sonicated particles using DLS. Indication that α-synuclein fibrils are sonicated to the terminal size can be extrapolated from the distribution of size populations after 10 aqs. 5 sec apart DLS measurement. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed0so","text":"1. There is one single population of size in a range of 10-100 nm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek32t","text":"2. Average radius is 20-30 nm for human fibrils and 15-25 for mouse fibrils","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u1eh","text":"3. %Mass is no less 95% for the size population from 10-100 nm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bcja","text":"See examples below","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4274","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hig4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fgsrp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"creator":{"affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/avatars/011.png","source":"/img/avatars/011.png","webp_source":""},"link":null,"name":"andrew.west","username":"n4ple1z1q1t4ule1"},"guid":"65F49A90DA2F11EC8E23B5666CE5A33E","id":63013,"image":{"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pirubtucf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pirubtucf.jpg","webp_placeholder":null,"webp_source":null},"load_collapsed":true,"stats":{"number_of_steps":7},"title":"Dynamic Light Scattering measurements","title_html":"Dynamic Light Scattering measurements","type_id":1,"uri":"dynamic-light-scattering-measurements-b9sdr6a6"}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4qib2","text":"This protocol outlines a method for quantifying endocytosis in primary neuronal cultures, specifically focusing on different a-synuclein fibril structures. By utilizing pH-sensitive dye conjugated to experimental proteins/fibrils, we can identify endocytosis pathways and analyze intensity changes in the pHrodo-specific channel from real-time acquired images at various time points. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"5c934","text":"The protocols.io team notes that research involving animals and humans must be conducted according to internationally-accepted standards and should always have prior approval from an Institutional Ethics Committee or Board.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7AAB2C3B530C11EF9BF00A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5q3ks","text":"For the assay we use DIV7 primary hippocampal neuron culture plated in 48-well plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmitf","text":"Before adding protein/drug of interest, add endocytosis inhibitors 30 minutes before the treatment. As calculated for 48-well plates with 3 mL of the media, 30 ul of diluted drugs are sufficient. ** Note: Be careful adding the diluted drugs (should be RT). Place the plate back to the cell culture incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c1pcu","text":"After two hours of incubation, start taking images of each well at the high-speed (high sensitive mode)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kp6m","text":"Continue acquiring images every two to four hours up to 48 hours of incubation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5l9li","text":"Calculate the images using cell count (Hoechst) for normalization and calculate the signal for each time-point as a proportion to the maxima of the signal ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kene","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c298f","text":"Calculate the signal from Lysotracker after 30 minutes of incubation and compare the control (no endocytosis inhibitors) to the experimental reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s1n6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
